location: Florence. Without the walls. A tucket afar off.

lines.text: Enter an old Widow of Florence, DIANA, VIOLENTA, and MARIANA, with other Citizens

lines.speaker: widow
lines.text: Nay, come; for if they do approach the city, we shall lose all the sight.

lines.speaker: diana
lines.text: They say the French count has done most honourable service.

lines.speaker: widow
lines.text: It is reported that he has taken their greatest commander; and that with his own hand he slew the duke's brother. We have lost our labour; they are gone a contrary way: hark! you may know by their trumpets.
Tucket

lines.speaker: mariana
lines.text: Come, let's return again, and suffice ourselves with the report of it. Well, Diana, take heed of this French earl: the honour of a maid is her name; and no legacy is so rich as honesty.

lines.speaker: widow
lines.text: I have told my neighbour how you have been solicited by a gentleman his companion.

lines.speaker: mariana
lines.text: I know that knave; hang him! one Parolles: a filthy officer he is in those suggestions for the young earl. Beware of them, Diana; their promises, enticements, oaths, tokens, and all these engines of lust, are not the things they go under: many a maid hath been seduced by them; and the misery is, example, that so terrible shows in the wreck of maidenhood, cannot for all that dissuade succession, but that they are limed with the twigs that threaten them. I hope I need not to advise you further; but I hope your own grace will keep you where you are, though there were no further danger known but the modesty which is so lost.

lines.speaker: diana
lines.text: You shall not need to fear me.

lines.speaker: widow
lines.text: I hope so. Look, here comes a pilgrim: I know she will lie at my house; thither they send one another: I'll question her. God save you, pilgrim! whither are you bound?
Enter HELENA, disguised like a Pilgrim

lines.speaker: helena
lines.text: To Saint Jaques le Grand. Where do the palmers lodge, I do beseech you?

lines.speaker: widow
lines.text: At the Saint Francis here beside the port.

lines.speaker: helena
lines.text: Is this the way?

lines.speaker: widow
lines.text: Ay, marry, is't. Hark you! they come this way. If you will tarry, holy pilgrim, But till the troops come by, I will conduct you where you shall be lodged; The rather, for I think I know your hostess As ample as myself.
A march afar

lines.speaker: helena
lines.text: Is it yourself?

lines.speaker: widow
lines.text: If you shall please so, pilgrim.

lines.speaker: helena
lines.text: I thank you, and will stay upon your leisure.

lines.speaker: widow
lines.text: You came, I think, from France?

lines.speaker: helena
lines.text: I did so.

lines.speaker: widow
lines.text: Here you shall see a countryman of yours That has done worthy service.

lines.speaker: helena
lines.text: His name, I pray you.

lines.speaker: diana
lines.text: The Count Rousillon: know you such a one?

lines.speaker: helena
lines.text: But by the ear, that hears most nobly of him: His face I know not.

lines.speaker: diana
lines.text: Whatsome'er he is, He's bravely taken here. He stole from France, As 'tis reported, for the king had married him Against his liking: think you it is so?

lines.speaker: helena
lines.text: Ay, surely, mere the truth: I know his lady.

lines.speaker: diana
lines.text: There is a gentleman that serves the count Reports but coarsely of her.

lines.speaker: helena
lines.text: What's his name?

lines.speaker: diana
lines.text: Monsieur Parolles.

lines.speaker: helena
lines.text: O, I believe with him, In argument of praise, or to the worth Of the great count himself, she is too mean To have her name repeated: all her deserving Is a reserved honesty, and that I have not heard examined.

lines.speaker: diana
lines.text: Alas, poor lady! 'Tis a hard bondage to become the wife Of a detesting lord.

lines.speaker: widow
lines.text: I warrant, good creature, wheresoe'er she is, Her heart weighs sadly: this young maid might do her A shrewd turn, if she pleased.

lines.speaker: helena
lines.text: How do you mean? May be the amorous count solicits her In the unlawful purpose.

lines.speaker: widow
lines.text: He does indeed; And brokes with all that can in such a suit Corrupt the tender honour of a maid: But she is arm'd for him and keeps her guard In honestest defence.

lines.speaker: mariana
lines.text: The gods forbid else!

lines.speaker: widow
lines.text: So, now they come: That is Antonio, the duke's eldest son; That, Escalus.
Drum and Colours
Enter BERTRAM, PAROLLES, and the whole army

lines.speaker: helena
lines.text: Which is the Frenchman?

lines.speaker: diana
lines.text: He; That with the plume: 'tis a most gallant fellow. I would he loved his wife: if he were honester He were much goodlier: is't not a handsome gentleman?

lines.speaker: helena
lines.text: I like him well.

lines.speaker: diana
lines.text: 'Tis pity he is not honest: yond's that same knave That leads him to these places: were I his lady, I would Poison that vile rascal.

lines.speaker: helena
lines.text: Which is he?

lines.speaker: diana
lines.text: That jack-an-apes with scarfs: why is he melancholy?

lines.speaker: helena
lines.text: Perchance he's hurt i' the battle.

lines.speaker: parolles
lines.text: Lose our drum! well.

lines.speaker: mariana
lines.text: He's shrewdly vexed at something: look, he has spied us.

lines.speaker: widow
lines.text: Marry, hang you!

lines.speaker: mariana
lines.text: And your courtesy, for a ring-carrier!
Exeunt BERTRAM, PAROLLES, and army

lines.speaker: widow
lines.text: The troop is past. Come, pilgrim, I will bring you Where you shall host: of enjoin'd penitents There's four or five, to great Saint Jaques bound, Already at my house.

lines.speaker: helena
lines.text: I humbly thank you: Please it this matron and this gentle maid To eat with us to-night, the charge and thanking Shall be for me; and, to requite you further, I will bestow some precepts of this virgin Worthy the note.

lines.speaker: both
lines.text: We'll take your offer kindly.
Exeunt
